text: Joseph Émile Alcide "Butch" Bouchard, CM, CQ (September 4, 1919 – April 14, 2012) was a Canadian ice hockey player who played defence with the Montreal Canadiens in the National Hockey League from 1941 to 1956. He is a member of the Hockey Hall of Fame, won four Stanley Cups, was captain of the Canadiens for eight years and was voted to the NHL All-Star Team four times. ==Other websites== * * NYTimes obituary Category:1919 births Category:2012 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey defencemen Category:Hockey Hall of Fame inductees Category:Ice hockey people from Quebec Category:Montreal Canadiens players Category:Providence Reds players Category:Sportspeople from Montreal Category:Stanley Cup champions
title: Émile Bouchard
